text: The men's doubles bowling competitions at the 2019 Pan American Games in Lima, Peru were held between 25 and 27 July 2019. == Schedule == All times are in Peru Time (UTC-5). {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round ! Grand Total |- | |align=left|||align=left|Jakob Butturff Nicholas Pate |3054 2491||5545 |- | |align=left|||align=left|Manuel Otalora Alfredo Quintana |2763 2752||5515 |- | |align=left|||align=left|José Llergo Arturo Quintero |2771 2608||5379 |- | |align=left|||align=left|Francois Lavoie Dan Maclelland |2753 2599||5352 |- | |align=left|||align=left|Jonaykel Conejo Marco Moretti |2605 2744||5349 |- | |align=left|||align=left|Luis Rovaina Ildemaro Ruiz |2539 2763||5302 |- | |align=left|||align=left|Adrian Guibu Yum Ishikawa |2506 2761||5267 |- | |align=left|||align=left|Damien Matthews David Maycock |2570 2630||5200 |- | |align=left|||align=left|Jonathan Hocsman Lucas Legnani |2408 2761||5169 |- |10 |align=left|||align=left|Diego Aguilar Armando Batres |2535 2510||5045 |- |11 |align=left|||align=left|Alex Prats Rolando Sebelen |2581 2459||5040 |- |12 |align=left|||align=left|Bruno Costa Marcelo Suartz |2482 2401||4883 |- |13 |align=left|||align=left|Jonathan Bremo Yannick Roos |2239 2413||4652 |- |14 |align=left|||align=left|Santiago Escobar Donald Lee |2730 2280||4650 |- |15 |align=left|||align=left|Julio Acosta Luis Bendeck |2158 2342||4500 |- |DSQJean Pérez Faure has tested positive for doping with chlorthalidone, a prohibited diuretic. The Panam Sports Disciplinary Commission announced this positive the day the Lima Games are closed, on 11 August 2019. As a consequence, the Puerto Rican duo loses gold, which passes to the United States. Colombia gets the silver and the bronze goes to the Mexico team.
